reviews.review_msg: FASS225 is a 1-credit pass or fail course. It is unclear how many assignments there will be in a given week. The course content is somewhat repetitive. The general advice is invest while you are young and consider sunk cost. Recommend if you are unfamiliar with the basics of personal finance (saving/investing).

Even though class attendance isn't mandatory, there are in-class assignments and quizzes (published during class time), and I highly recommend attending because Mark's lectures are super engaging â€“ he makes it a discussion between him and students and tells fun personal anecdotes related to course content! Homework is also easy and helpful.

Not sure what's up with the bad reviews. Mark gave good advice. He makes himself available with appointments for students to chat, even after our last class. He has experience and provides good sources. What you get out of this is what you make of it - if you have questions, he'll answer.  Homework is as expected for a 1 credit pass/fail.

Mark is amazing. This is one of the best classes I took at SFU. He manages to keep the class engaged for the full 3 hours. He tells a lot of stories that relate to finances which I found very helpful. He gives legit advice for youth who want to start taking control of their own finances. I would take more classes with him if offered more.

Charismatic guy for sure, though is blinded by his own privilege and experiences. The class is about financial advice, but unfortunately, Mark doesn't realize that a lot of the advice he gives isn't applicable to a large part of the population (not everybody has parents and neighbors who can loan them a few hundred thousand dollars.)
Great prof, and easy course. Lots to learn about finances and your personal investments for future as a student.
Easy course and really good stuff to learn about investments and finances for your future. Highly recommended.
